The typical demon throng consists of a chaotic mix of less powerful demons— typically [abrikandilus](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1110), [dretches](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1109), and [quasits](/Monsters.aspx?ID=97), with a few [brimoraks](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1111), [babaus](/Monsters.aspx?ID=598) or other, more powerful demons swept up in the mayhem. This tangled mess of different creatures makes coordinated tactics untenable but, while individual demons in the throng might not be able to fully utilize their abilities, the throng itself makes up for these deficiencies with dangerous options of its own. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 36 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31 [Demonic Rabble](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2525) **Source** [Pathfinder #191: The Destiny War](/Sources.aspx?ID=199) pg. 82 **Perception** +23; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +25, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +25 **Str** +6 **Dex** +4 **Con** +5 **Int** +0 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +4 --- **AC** 33 **Fort** +25 **Ref** +21 **Will** +21 +1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) **HP** 260 (16 squares) **Weaknesses** area damage 15, [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 10, good 10, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=150) damage 10 **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=17)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 30 feet, DC 30
**Serenity Vulnerability** A demonic rabble thrives on mayhem, and when members of the throng find themselves facing moments of calm, however brief or temporary, the throng suffers. Whenever the demonic rabble fails a saving throw against an affect that would normally [fascinate](/Conditions.aspx?ID=14), [fatigue](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15), [paralyze](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [restrain](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33), or [slow](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) at least four creatures, the troop takes 3d6 mental damage.
**[Troop Defenses](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=44)** --- **Speed** 25 feet **Claws, Fangs, and Horns** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The throng rips and tears at each enemy within its squares and within 5 feet (DC 33 Reflex save). Damage depends on the number of actions.
**Damage** 1d10+12 slashing plus 1d6 evil
**Damage** 2d10+12 slashing plus 1d6 evil
**Damage** 3d10+12 slashing plus 1d6 evil **Demonic Tide** A demonic rabble is less organized and more vicious than most troops. They can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into their spaces. Their spaces are difficult terrain to non-demon creatures. The first time during a turn that a creature hostile to the throng willingly moves into their space, that creature is subjected to the one-action version of Claws, Fangs, and Horns. **[Form Up](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=43)** **Hurl Debris** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The throng hurls debris, creating a 10-foot burst within 30 feet (DC 25 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). When the throng is reduced to 8 or fewer squares, this area decreases to a 5-foot burst. Damage depends on the number of actions.
**Damage** 2d10 bludgeoning
**Damage** 4d10 bludgeoning
**Damage** 6d10 bludgeoning **Troop Movement** Whenever the rabble Strides, they first [Form Up](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=43) as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to their Speed.
name: Demonic Rabble
